post.description:
As a Company Admin you can use this route to _impersonate_ another Customer Profile that belongs to your Corporate Profile.
An example of this flow end-to-end looks like this:
```
  curl --location --request POST 'https://api.homebotapp.com/customer-profiles/<customer_profile_id>/impersonations'
  --header 'Authorization: open-api-token-v1 <your_api_token_here> '
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json'
  --data-raw '{
      "data": {
          "type": "impersonations"
      }
  }'
```

Dig into the `access-token` attribute in the payload and use the value to make requests against other endpoints _as_ the Customer Profile you just impersonated:

```
    curl --location --request GET 'api.homebotapp.com/clients'
    --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access-token>'
    --data-raw ''
```

Impersonation tokens expire 2 hours after you've requested them. The impersonation endpoint only works for Company Admins.

201.description: It returns an access token for the impersatee

403.description: It returns a 403

get.description: Retrieves all WebhookClients.

type.description: The resource Type of this record

auth-username.description: Username for basic HTTP auth credentials when Homebot posts to your webhook listener URL

created-at.description: Timestamp (UTC) when the webhook client was created

event-sources-whitelist.description: An optional array of event sources that determines which events will be sent. If no value is provided, all events will be sent. Valid values are: `buyer-digest`, `homebot-for-chrome`, `listings-bot`, `customer`, `email`, `home-digest`, `nest-ready-home-search`, `sms`, `system`, `ylopo`

name.description: Name of webhook client (Useful to differentiate when user has multiple webhook clients)

updated-at.description: Timestamp (UTC) when the webhook client was last updated

url.description: Full URL (e.g., https://example.com/homebot/callback) to which webhook events will be sent

get.description:
Retrieves all WebhookEvents.

WebhookEvent payloads are comprised of [ClientEvents](https://homebot-inc.stoplight.io/docs/open-api/c2NoOjM4MDQyODEy-client-event).

id.description: a unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem. (eg: email#presence)

status.description: the status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

code.description: a status error code, expressed as a string value.

title.description: a short, human-readable summary of the problem.

detail.description: a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

source.description:
an object containing references to the source of the error via the pointer
a JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. "/data" for a primary data object, or "/data/attributes/email" for a specific attribute].

Error.description:
On an unsuccessful request, error objects should be returned with details around the issues.

Below is a list of error codes that can be returned and what they are used for.

* VALIDATION_ERROR = '100' 
* INVALID_RESOURCE = '101' 
* FILTER_NOT_ALLOWED = '102' 
* INVALID_FIELD_VALUE = '103' 
* INVALID_FIELD = '104' 
* PARAM_NOT_ALLOWED = '105' 
* PARAM_MISSING = '106' 
* INVALID_FILTER_VALUE = '107' 
* COUNT_MISMATCH = '108' 
* KEY_ORDER_MISMATCH = '109' 
* KEY_NOT_INCLUDED_IN_URL = '110' 
* INVALID_INCLUDE = '112' 
* RELATION_EXISTS = '113' 
* INVALID_SORT_CRITERIA = '114' 
* INVALID_LINKS_OBJECT = '115' 
* TYPE_MISMATCH = '116' 
* INVALID_PAGE_OBJECT = '117' 
* INVALID_PAGE_VALUE = '118' 
* INVALID_FIELD_FORMAT = '119' 
* INVALID_FILTERS_SYNTAX = '120' 
* SAVE_FAILED = '121' 
* FORBIDDEN = '403' 
* RECORD_NOT_FOUND = '404' 
* NOT_ACCEPTABLE = '406' 
* UNSUPPORTED_MEDIA_TYPE = '415' 
* LOCKED = '423'

ClientEvent.description:
ClientEvents are sent to WebhookClient owners as WebhookEvents.

See the [Understanding ClientEvents page](https://homebot-inc.stoplight.io/docs/open-api/ZG9jOjM4MDQyODA4-undertanding-client-events) for a full list of events, including additional details and examples of each.

id.description: Unique identifier for the WebhookEvent object.

attributes.description: A hash containing the details of the WebhookEvent.

attempt.description: Number of attempts made to the WebhookClient. Max number of attempts is 25.

created_at.description: The timestamp (UTC) when the WebhookEvent was created.

last_tried_at.description: The timestamp (UTC) of the most recent attempt to deliver the WebhookEvent to the WebhookClient.

event_data.description: A hash containing the event record.

id.description: Unique identifier for the event object.

action.description: A short, human-readable name for the event.

client_id.description: Unique identifier for the associated Client object.

properties.description: A hash containing additional information about the event.

source.description: A short, human-readable description of the source of the event within Homebot.

created_at.description: The timestamp (UTC) when the event was created.

Authorization.description:
Private API token with a format of `Authorization: <type> <value>`
`type` is set to `open-api-token-v1`
`value` is set to your API token value
Example:
```
Authorization: open-api-token-v1 74c5295fh19a20v70212fa440359f149e5f628
```
Authorization.name: Authorization
